DataElement.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Failed Performed Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the reason for a failed or unsuccessful breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Conservation Treatment Post Neoadjuvant Therapy Failed Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a failed or unsuccessful breast conservation treatment, surgical excision limited to the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue followed by radiation therapy, following neoadjuvant therapy, treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Concepts.definition: Breast conservation treatment is defined as excision of the primary tumor and adjacent breast tissue, followed by radiation therapy.  This procedure is also referred to as lumpectomy, segmental mastectomy, or partial mastectomy. (from Consensus Statements: Treatment of Early-stage Breast Cancer, 1990)

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.:Having undergone failure; did not accomplish the intended purpose.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
Having undergone failure; did not accomplish the intended purpose.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify result of a therapeutic intervention.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
